TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in PERSON .
The applicant and her husband were married in DATE .
On DATE the applicant ’s husband placed CARDINAL NORP lei ( MDL ) on a DATE deposit account in a private bank , with PERCENT DATE interest .
On DATE he asked the bank for early termination of the contract and the repayment of his money . The bank did not comply with his request .
The applicant ’s husband brought an action against the bank , seeking the termination of the deposit contract and the repayment of his money and interest .
By a judgment of DATE ORG ruled in favour of the applicant ’s husband and ordered the bank to pay him MDL CARDINAL . On DATE the judgment became final and enforceable .
On DATE ORG issued a decision suspending the bank ’s licence . It also ordered liquidation procedures to be commenced and appointed an administrator for that purpose .

In DATE the applicant ’s husband brought a new action against the bank , seeking compensation for inflation . On DATE ORG ruled in his favour and ordered the bank to pay him MDL CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE the judgment became final and enforceable .
On DATE the applicant ’s husband asked the administrator to enforce the judgments of CARDINAL DATE and DATE . The latter did not reply to his request .

On an unspecified date , the applicant ’s husband brought an action against ORG , seeking the payment of the money owed to him by the private bank . He argued that ORG was the regulatory authority in respect of all financial institutions and should be held responsible for the bankruptcy of the private bank .

On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s husband ’s action . It found that ORG was not responsible for the private bank ’s obligations towards its clients . On DATE ORG dismissed his appeal against the judgment of DATE . By a final judgment of DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s husband ’s appeal on points of law .
On DATE the applicant ’s husband died . On DATE the applicant received an inheritance certificate and became the sole owner of his part of their joint property .

On an unspecified date , the applicant ’s husband sent a letter to ORG and complained about the non - enforcement of the judgments in his favour . On DATE the ORG readdressed the letter to the President of ORG and requested the court to respond to the applicant ’s request . On DATE the President of ORG and the Bailiff replied to the applicant ’s husband that the bank did not have money in its accounts or other assets . They also informed him that the enforcement warrants had been given to the administrator of the bank , who should ensure their enforcement .

On DATE the applicant ’s husband ’s requested the administrator to enforce the judgments . On DATE the latter informed him that the bank was subject to a liquidation procedure and that the judgments could not be enforced .

Following the applicant ’s complaint to the ORG about the non - enforcement of the judgments , on CARDINAL DATE ORG informed her that the payment would be made as soon as the loans , which had been previously granted by the bank , were reimbursed and that the administrator had initiated numerous proceedings for their reimbursement . It also informed her that ORG could not be held responsible for a private bank ’s obligations towards its clients .

On DATE and CARDINAL DATE ORG replied to the applicant ’s complaints about the non - enforcement of the judgments and informed her that ORG had created a working commission , with the aim of examining the situation of bankrupt banks and the mechanism of reimbursement of deposited money .
The relevant domestic law was set out in GPE and Others v. GPE , nos . CARDINAL , CARDINAL , ORG , CARDINAL/CARDINAL , CARDINAL/CARDINAL and GPE , § CARDINAL , DATE .
